title: Getting started with geosam
text: Getting set geosam takes steps. First, install package GitHub: : installed, load package set SAM3 Python environment geosam_install(). default, run arguments, geosam_install() use uv Python environment. creates dedicated uv environment PyTorch HuggingFace transformers. prefer use venv conda Python environment management, can supply appropriate argument geosam_install(): set Python environment named geosam unless supply alternative name envname. Windows, ’ll need couple additional tools: Git: Required install SAM3 GitHub. Download git-scm.com install default settings. Rtools: Required compile R package dependencies. Download CRAN. installing , restart R session running geosam_install().
code: remotes::install_github("walkerke/geosam") pak::pak("walkerke/geosam") library(geosam) geosam_install() geosam_install(method = "conda") # or method = "virtualenv"

title: Getting started with geosam
text: Windows, ’ll need couple additional tools: Git: Required install SAM3 GitHub. Download git-scm.com install default settings. Rtools: Required compile R package dependencies. Download CRAN. installing , restart R session running geosam_install().

title: Getting started with geosam
text: geosam uses Meta’s SAM3 model hosted HuggingFace, requires authentication. ’ll need complete two steps: request access model, set access token. First, visit SAM3 model page HuggingFace click “Request access.” ’ll need free HuggingFace account. Access typically granted quickly, may take hours. access, ’ll need User Access Token. HuggingFace account, go Settings > Access Tokens create new token. “read” token sufficient geosam since ’re downloading model weights—read tokens safer case token accidentally exposed. easiest way authenticate save token machine using HuggingFace CLI. terminal: saves token ~/.cache/huggingface/token, geosam find automatically. Alternatively, can set token environment variable R. persistent use across sessions, add .Renviron file: set single session: satellite imagery, geosam supports three providers. Mapbox offers high-quality imagery requires API key: Esri World Imagery works without API key, making good option getting started. MapTiler also supported MAPTILER_API_KEY environment variable.
code: huggingface-cli login # Open your .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ()  # Add this line: # HF_TOKEN=hf_xxxxx Sys.setenv(HF_TOKEN = "hf_xxxxx") Sys.setenv(MAPBOX_PUBLIC_TOKEN = "pk.xxxxx")

title: Getting started with geosam
text: First, visit SAM3 model page HuggingFace click “Request access.” ’ll need free HuggingFace account. Access typically granted quickly, may take hours.

title: Getting started with geosam
text: access, ’ll need User Access Token. HuggingFace account, go Settings > Access Tokens create new token. “read” token sufficient geosam since ’re downloading model weights—read tokens safer case token accidentally exposed. easiest way authenticate save token machine using HuggingFace CLI. terminal: saves token ~/.cache/huggingface/token, geosam find automatically. Alternatively, can set token environment variable R. persistent use across sessions, add .Renviron file: set single session:
code: huggingface-cli login # Open your .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ()  # Add this line: # HF_TOKEN=hf_xxxxx Sys.setenv(HF_TOKEN = "hf_xxxxx")

title: Getting started with geosam
text: satellite imagery, geosam supports three providers. Mapbox offers high-quality imagery requires API key: Esri World Imagery works without API key, making good option getting started. MapTiler also supported MAPTILER_API_KEY environment variable.
code: Sys.setenv(MAPBOX_PUBLIC_TOKEN = "pk.xxxxx")

title: Getting started with geosam
text: running first detection, verify everything configured correctly: show status Python environment, whether GPU acceleration available (MPS Apple Silicon, CUDA NVIDIA), whether HuggingFace token configured. everything shows green checkmarks, ’re ready go.
code: geosam_status()  ── geosam Status ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ℹ Environment: uv at /Users/kylewalker/.geosam/venvs/geosam ✔ Python: 3.12 ℹ Path: /Users/kylewalker/.geosam/venvs/geosam/bin/python ✔ PyTorch 2.9.1: MPS (Apple Silicon) ✔ transformers: available (SAM3 via HuggingFace) ✔ HuggingFace token: configured

title: Getting started with geosam
text: Let’s detect football fields TCU campus Fort Worth. sam_detect() function main workhorse satellite imagery detection. provide bounding box, describe ’re looking text prompt, geosam handles rest—downloading imagery, running SAM3 inference, returning georeferenced results.  bbox argument takes coordinates WGS84 (longitude/latitude) c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax). can also pass sf object geosam extract bounding box automatically. first time run detection, SAM3 download model weights HuggingFace (2.5 GB). happens subsequent runs use cached model.
code: field <- sam_detect(   bbox = c(-97.372, 32.707, -97.366, 32.712),   text = "football field",   source = "mapbox",   zoom = 17 ) ℹ Mapbox imagery is governed by the Mapbox Terms of Service.   See: <https://www.mapbox.com/legal/tos/> ℹ Downloading Mapbox imagery at zoom 17...  ℹ Fetching 12 tiles (4x3)...  ✔ Saved imagery to: /var/folders/qm/xbtsglmj2ss91z9fzpz8k6q8ylngb5/T//Rtmphmxw9e/file7c02307be280.tif  ℹ Reading image...  ℹ Running SAM3 detection...  ✔ Detected 2 objects. plot(field)

title: Getting started with geosam
text: Use sam_view() explore detections interactively:  opens Shiny application satellite imagery basemap detections overlaid polygons. can adjust confidence threshold slider filter lower-quality detections, click individual polygons see confidence scores. , ’ve picked field inside football stadium well nearby practice field. Zoom bit view - ’ll see white box representing extraction area. area searched features matching text prompt.
code: sam_view(field)

title: Getting started with geosam
text: ’re ready work results R, extract sf object: resulting sf object includes score column confidence values (0–1) area_m2 column area detection square meters. , can filter, analyze, export detections using standard sf workflows.
code: field_sf <- sam_as_sf(field)  field_sf Simple feature collection with 2 features and 3 fields Geometry type: POLYGON Dimension:     XY Bounding box:  xmin: -97.3687 ymin: 32.70723 xmax: -97.36656 ymax: 32.7102 Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84       score mask_id                       geometry  area_m2 1 0.8473608       1 POLYGON ((-97.36773 32.7083... 17715.08 2 0.8100375       2 POLYGON ((-97.36834 32.7102... 11380.70

title: Getting started with geosam
text: Satellite Imagery Detection - Full guide geospatial workflows Regular Image Detection - Working photos screenshots Interactive Workflows - Using explore view interfaces

title: Regular image detection
text: work non-georeferenced images, use sam_image(). ’ll work sample photo testing bundled package.  extract objects image, pass image path sam_image(): get geosam_image object back. object can plotted plot():  SAM3 found strawberries. can also try different prompts image, combine plots add = TRUE, much typical base R plotting. Let’s try different prompts image:
code: library(geosam)  # Path to bundled sample image fruit <- system.file("extdata", "fruit_plate.jpg", package = "geosam")  # Detect strawberries berries <- sam_image(fruit, text = "strawberry")  berries plot(berries) cherries <- sam_image(fruit, text = "cherry") p <- plot(cherries)  chocolate <- sam_image(fruit, text = "chocolate") plot(chocolate, add = TRUE, base_img = p, fill = "purple")

title: Regular image detection
text: Much like extracted objects satellite images, can convert extractions “spatial” objects pixel coordinates sam_as_sf(). Let’s try : Note result includes area_px (area square pixels) instead area_m2.

title: Regular image detection
text: hands-detection clicking drawing can use sam_explore_image(). Pass image path ’ll launch Shiny gadget allows interactively explore image. interface uses mapgl MapLibre hood, can pan zoom interactive map. Let’s try : text option allows enter six text prompts extract interactively image. , show extraction detecting cherries, strawberries, nuts, chocolate, glass, book image. interactive viewer finds objects, gives us map legend along pop-ups.  app also supports “Example” mode can draw around objects use exemplars “Points” mode can click identify objects; see Interactive vignette examples action satellite imagery. click “Done”, results returned geosam_image object R session long ’ve assigned result variable. Let’s take look : Note get back prompt prompt_color columns tell us prompt associated object.
code: result <- sam_explore_image(fruit) result Simple feature collection with 76 features and 5 fields Geometry type: GEOMETRY Dimension:     XY Bounding box:  xmin: 129 ymin: 0 xmax: 1280 ymax: 1493 CRS:           NA First 10 features:    mask_id     score area_px   prompt prompt_color                       geometry 1        1 0.7182140    8287 cherries      #facc15 MULTIPOLYGON (((1024 753, 1... 2        2 0.5578738    3340 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((779 901, 779 900,... 3        3 0.6574008    2829 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((659 961, 659 959,... 4        4 0.7631093    8354 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((842 825, 842 824,... 5        5 0.8512306    9918 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((885 1102, 885 110... 6        6 0.7179651    3449 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((658 729, 658 728,... 7        7 0.8434036   10636 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((1014 972, 1014 97... 8        8 0.8085137    8738 cherries      #facc15 MULTIPOLYGON (((944 1018, 9... 9        9 0.7799412    8565 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((824 1003, 824 100... 10      10 0.7946509    7510 cherries      #facc15 POLYGON ((637 1096, 637 109...

title: Interactive workflows
text: sam_explore() opens interactive map can navigate, detect objects, export results: interface lets : Navigate location using map search Text prompts: Type description detect objects (e.g., “swimming pool”) Exemplar prompts: Draw shape around example object find similar ones Point prompts: Click map indicate object locations Adjust threshold: Use slider filter confidence Export: Return extracted results R session Let’s try . ’ll focus golf course Colonial Country Club Fort Worth. initialize map view specific location sam_explore(), specify center zoom. can also supply bounding box sf object bbox initialize view .  explorer defaults source = "mapbox"; use "esri" "maptiler" Esri World Imagery MapTiler Satellite, respectively. Let’s try first detection text prompt. explorer search visible area viewport. Set confidence threshold govern return, extraction zoom (16 18) specify level detail underlying imagery. Choosing 16 make process run faster, choosing 18 give accuracy.  search “sand traps” pretty good job! However, note false positives, sand trap found across Trinity River know incorrect. Given extracted large area high zoom (18), also notice artifacts tiling process geosam uses internally (can cleaned sam_merge_edges()). turn, may make sense refine search. “Example” mode allows us use exemplar-based detection draw shape around object type want, tell SAM3 extract everything image looks like shape. Vertex-based polygon drawing rectangles supported using mapgl’s draw control.  example, zoomed section golf course drew shape around sand trap. good job overall! one sand trap view missed - can see partially obscured trees lower part view. want capture specific objects view, try “Points” example. allow interactively click locations map tell SAM3 extract objects locations. Let’s give try.  example, able manually locate sand traps, including trap obscured tree; helped SAM3 find . finished interactive session, click Done button. return extraction result back R session, named object assigned sam_explore() result .

title: Satellite imagery detection
text: don’t satellite imagery use, can download imagery geosam Mapbox, Esri World Imagery, MapTiler get_imagery() function. Let’s grab imagery Mapbox section Beverly Hills, California: zoom level control level detail downloaded imagery, larger zooms resulting higher resolution images. function returns path GeoTIFF file containing downloaded imagery. can plot terra package:  can use GeoTIFF file input sam_detect() function, can simply use sam_detect() download satellite imagery run detection one step. find swimming pools section Beverly Hills: pools object class geosam represents extraction result. visualize results extraction, use plot():  Plotting geosam objects visualize extracted polygons original imagery. , see extracted pools visualized yellow Mapbox image. interactive exploration, use sam_view(). launches Shiny app can adjust confidence threshold slider, click polygons see details, export results GeoJSON: sam_view() launches Shiny gadget gives interactive view extraction results. viewer uses imagery source (Mapbox, Esri, MapTiler) detection, results align basemap. white rectangle represents area SAM3 scanned extraction results. Click extracted object view index confidence score (0-1), filter results confidence score, export result GeoJSON ’d like.  Please note terms service satellite imagery providers. providers allow feature extraction satellite imagery non-commercial usage, can use tool research analysis purposes. aren’t allowed extract data imagery re-sell . geosam MIT-licensed, alone responsible honoring terms service use package.
code: library(geosam)  imagery <- get_imagery(   bbox = c(-118.41, 34.09, -118.405, 34.095),   source = "mapbox",   zoom = 18 )  imagery [1] "/var/folders/qm/xbtsglmj2ss91z9fzpz8k6q8ylngb5/T//Rtmp0fDAZQ/file7c64172af9bd.tif" library(terra)  plotRGB(rast(imagery)) library(geosam)  pools <- sam_detect(   bbox = c(-118.41, 34.09, -118.405, 34.095),   text = "swimming pool",   source = "mapbox",   zoom = 18 )  pools plot(pools) sam_view(pools)

title: Satellite imagery detection
text: existing georeferenced satellite aerial imagery, can pass file path directly use sam_detect(). geosam bundles imagery chip Mumbai, India SpaceNet dataset can experiment . Let’s take look .  sam_detect() found 73 buildings, generally picking discrete structures leaving densely-packed areas. One reason sam_detect() defaults confidence threshold 0.5 extraction results. want generous extraction return results found SAM3, can lower threshold:  175 objects now detected, picking buildings view also returning false positives. Experiment different types prompts see get back. example, can look trees image:  SAM3 also understands color, can segment image object color needed.
code: # geosam includes a sample WorldView-3 chip from Mumbai (SpaceNet dataset) mumbai <- system.file("extdata", "mumbai_chip.tif", package = "geosam")  buildings <- sam_detect(   image = mumbai,   text = "building" )  plot(buildings) buildings_01 <- sam_detect(   image = mumbai,   text = "building",   threshold = 0.1 )  plot(buildings_01) trees <- sam_detect(image = mumbai, text = "trees", threshold = 0.3) plot(trees) blue_roofs <- sam_detect(image = mumbai, text = "blue roof", threshold = 0.2) plot(blue_roofs)

title: Satellite imagery detection
text: function sam_as_sf() convert object class geosam object class sf use spatial analysis workflows. Let’s convert original buildings object see get back. result includes polygon geometries, confidence scores, area square meters. Use sam_filter() filter score area extraction: sf object hand, can use extracted results downstream R’s suite spatial analysis mapping packages. example, can visualize polygons interactively mapgl R package: notice extractions perfectly align basemap; image source source basemap building footprints likely slightly different. reflects advantage using built-imagery pipelines package pulling directly map tiles providers allowing alignment interactive maps.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kyle Walker. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Walker K (2025). geosam: Geospatial Image Segmentation SAM3. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/walkerke/geosam.
code: @Manual{,   title = {geosam: Geospatial Image Segmentation with SAM3},   author = {Kyle Walker},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/walkerke/geosam}, }

title: geosam
text: geosam R package brings Meta’s Segment Anything Model 3 (SAM3) R detecting objects satellite imagery photos. Describe ’re looking plain text—training data model fine-tuning required. package inspired Python package segment-geospatial Qiusheng Wu, aims bring similar functionality R users. Install development version GitHub: set Python environment: ’ll need HuggingFace account access SAM3 model. Read vignettes learn use package: Getting started geosam Satellite imagery detection Regular image detection Interactive workflows
code: remotes::install_github("walkerke/geosam") library(geosam) geosam_install()

what: Support and how to learn more
title: geosam
text: find project useful work like ensure continued development package, can provide support following ways: Chip funds support package development via PayPal; Set consulting engagement workshop Walker Data help implement geosam project. Send note kyle@walker-data.com interested; File issue - even better, pull request - https://github.com/walkerke/geosam/issues. stay top package updates / new features get information trainings, sure sign Walker Data mailing list .

title: Clear Imagery Cache — geosam_clear_cache
text: Clears cached satellite imagery tiles.

title: Clear Imagery Cache — geosam_clear_cache
code: geosam_clear_cache()

title: Clear Imagery Cache — geosam_clear_cache
text: Invisibly returns TRUE.

title: Configure geosam Options — geosam_configure
text: Set package-wide configuration options model selection device.

title: Configure geosam Options — geosam_configure
code: geosam_configure(model = NULL, device = NULL, mapbox_token = NULL)

title: Configure geosam Options — geosam_configure
text: model Model use: "sam2" (default, latest) "sam" (original). device Computing device: "auto" (default), "mps", "cuda", "cpu". "auto" selects best available device. mapbox_token Mapbox access token satellite imagery. Can also set via MAPBOX_ACCESS_TOKEN environment variable.

title: Configure geosam Options — geosam_configure
text: Invisibly returns previous configuration.

title: Configure geosam Options — geosam_configure
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Use SAM 2 on CPU geosam_configure(model = "sam2", device = "cpu")  # Set Mapbox token geosam_configure(mapbox_token = "pk.xxx") } # }

what: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
text: Creates Python virtual environment installs required packages SAM3 inference. needs run .

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
code: geosam_install(   envname = "geosam",   method = c("uv", "virtualenv", "conda"),   gpu = NULL,   hf_token = NULL,   python_version = "3.12" )

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
text: envname Name virtual environment create (default: "geosam") method Installation method: "uv" (recommended, fast), "virtualenv", "conda". uv default recommended approach. gpu Logical. TRUE, installs GPU-enabled PyTorch. NULL (default), auto-detects based available hardware. hf_token Optional HuggingFace token accessing SAM3 model weights. Can also set via HF_TOKEN environment variable. Required SAM3. python_version Python version use (default: "3.12"). SAM3 requires 3.12+.

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
text: Invisibly returns TRUE success.

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
text: function installs: PyTorch 2.7+ (MPS support Apple Silicon, CUDA 12.6+ NVIDIA GPUs) SAM3 Meta (https://github.com/facebookresearch/sam3) rasterio, geopandas, shapely, pyproj (geospatial processing)

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
text: uv (recommended): Fast, modern Python package manager. Install uv first:   virtualenv: Uses Python's built-venv via reticulate. Requires Python 3.12+ installed system. conda: Uses conda/miniconda. Slower handles complex dependencies well.
code: # macOS/Linux curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh  # Windows (PowerShell) powershell -ExecutionPolicy ByPass -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"  # Or via pip (any platform) pip install uv

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
text: must HuggingFace access approval SAM3 model weights. Request access : https://huggingface.co/facebook/sam3

title: Install Python Dependencies for geosam — geosam_install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Standard installation with uv (recommended) geosam_install()  # With HuggingFace token geosam_install(hf_token = "hf_xxxxx")  # Use virtualenv instead of uv geosam_install(method = "virtualenv")  # Use conda geosam_install(method = "conda") } # }

title: Check geosam Installation Status — geosam_status
text: Checks Python environment reports features available.

title: Check geosam Installation Status — geosam_status
code: geosam_status()

title: Check geosam Installation Status — geosam_status
text: list installation status information, invisibly.

title: Check geosam Installation Status — geosam_status
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ geosam_status() } # }

title: Download Satellite Imagery — get_imagery
text: Downloads satellite imagery tiles bounding box saves GeoTIFF. Uses R-native tools (httr2, terra) reliable tile fetching georeferencing.

title: Download Satellite Imagery — get_imagery
code: get_imagery(   bbox,   output = NULL,   source = c("mapbox", "esri", "maptiler"),   zoom = 17,   api_key = NULL )

title: Download Satellite Imagery — get_imagery
text: bbox Bounding box area. Can numeric vector c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) WGS84, sf/sfc object. output Path output GeoTIFF. NULL, creates temp file. source Imagery source: "mapbox", "esri", "maptiler". "mapbox": Requires MAPBOX_PUBLIC_TOKEN environment variable "esri": Free Esri World Imagery (API key required) "maptiler": Requires MAPTILER_API_KEY environment variable zoom Tile zoom level (15-19). Higher values = detail. Recommended: 17-18 objects like buildings, swimming pools. api_key API key imagery source. Mapbox, uses MAPBOX_PUBLIC_TOKEN environment variable default. MapTiler, uses MAPTILER_API_KEY environment variable default.

title: Download Satellite Imagery — get_imagery
text: Path downloaded GeoTIFF file.

title: Download Satellite Imagery — get_imagery
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download imagery for an area img <- get_imagery(   bbox = c(-102.5, 31.8, -102.4, 31.9),   source = "mapbox",   zoom = 17 )  # Use with detection pads <- sam_detect(image = img, text = "swimming pool") } # }

title: Plot geosam Detection Results — plot.geosam
text: Displays satellite imagery detection polygons overlaid using terra.

title: Plot geosam Detection Results — plot.geosam
code: # S3 method for class 'geosam' plot(   x,   fill = "#FACC15",   border = NULL,   palette = NULL,   opacity = 0.5,   lwd = 1,   main = NULL,   add = FALSE,   ... )

title: Plot geosam Detection Results — plot.geosam
text: x geosam object sam_detect() sam_explore(). fill Fill color detection polygons. Default semi-transparent yellow. Ignored palette specified. border Border color polygon outlines. NULL (default), automatically darkens fill color. Set NA disable borders. palette Optional color palette distinct colors per detection. Can : character vector colors (recycled needed) palette name RColorBrewer (e.g., "Set1", "Dark2", "Paired") palette function takes n returns colors opacity Opacity fill colors (0-1). Default 0.5. Applied fills. lwd Line width polygon borders. Default 1. main Plot title. Default NULL (title). add TRUE, add existing plot instead creating new one. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed terra::plotRGB() add = FALSE.

title: Plot geosam Detection Results — plot.geosam
text: Invisibly returns sf polygons plotted.

title: Plot geosam Detection Results — plot.geosam
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(   bbox = c(-102.63, 31.81, -102.62, 31.83),   text = "swimming pool" ) plot(result)  # Distinct colors per detection plot(result, palette = "Set1")  # Custom colors plot(result, fill = "red")  # border auto-darkens  # Layer multiple results plot(result1) plot(result2, add = TRUE, fill = "blue") } # }

title: Plot geosam_image Detection Results — plot.geosam_image
text: Displays image detection masks overlaid using magick.

title: Plot geosam_image Detection Results — plot.geosam_image
code: # S3 method for class 'geosam_image' plot(   x,   fill = "#FACC15",   border = NULL,   palette = NULL,   opacity = 0.4,   border_width = 2,   add = FALSE,   base_img = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot geosam_image Detection Results — plot.geosam_image
text: x geosam_image object sam_image() sam_explore_image(). fill Fill color detection masks. Default yellow. Ignored palette specified. border Border color detection outlines. NULL (default), automatically darkens fill color. Set NA disable borders. palette Optional color palette distinct colors per detection. Can : character vector colors (recycled needed) palette name RColorBrewer (e.g., "Set1", "Dark2", "Paired") palette function takes n returns colors opacity Opacity mask overlay (0-1). Default 0.4. border_width Width border lines pixels. Default 2. add TRUE, add existing magick image instead loading file. Pass image x parameter's image_path ignored base_img must provided. base_img magick image add overlays . Required add = TRUE. ... Additional arguments (currently ignored).

title: Plot geosam_image Detection Results — plot.geosam_image
text: Invisibly returns composite magick image, can saved magick::image_write() manipulated.

title: Plot geosam_image Detection Results — plot.geosam_image
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_image("photo.jpg", text = "dog") plot(result)  # Distinct colors per detection plot(result, palette = "Set2")  # Custom color (border auto-matches) plot(result, fill = "red")  # Layer multiple detections img <- plot(result1) img <- plot(result2, add = TRUE, base_img = img, fill = "blue") img <- plot(result3, add = TRUE, base_img = img, fill = "red")  # Save the result magick::image_write(img, "annotated.png") } # }

what: Extract Raster Masks from geosam Object — sam_as_raster
title: Extract Raster Masks from geosam Object — sam_as_raster
text: Converts detection masks geosam object terra SpatRaster.

title: Extract Raster Masks from geosam Object — sam_as_raster
code: sam_as_raster(x, combined = FALSE)

title: Extract Raster Masks from geosam Object — sam_as_raster
text: x geosam object sam_detect() sam_explore(). combined TRUE, combine masks single layer (union). FALSE (default), return multi-layer raster one layer per detection.

title: Extract Raster Masks from geosam Object — sam_as_raster
text: terra SpatRaster mask values (1 = detected, 0 = background). Returns NULL masks.

title: Extract Raster Masks from geosam Object — sam_as_raster
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "building") mask_raster <- sam_as_raster(result, combined = TRUE) terra::plot(mask_raster) } # }

what: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
title: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
text: Converts detection masks sf polygon geometries.

title: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
code: sam_as_sf(x, min_area = NULL, max_area = NULL)

title: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
text: x geosam geosam_image object. min_area Minimum object area. geosam, square meters. geosam_image, square pixels. Objects smaller filtered . max_area Maximum object area. geosam, square meters. geosam_image, square pixels. Objects larger filtered .

title: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
text: sf data frame polygon geometries, scores, area. Returns NULL polygons remain filtering.

title: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
text: geosam objects (georeferenced imagery), returns polygons WGS84 coordinates area square meters. geosam_image objects (non-georeferenced images), returns polygons pixel coordinates x = column (left) y = row (top).

title: Extract sf Polygons from geosam or geosam_image Object — sam_as_sf
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Georeferenced imagery result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "building") buildings <- sam_as_sf(result, min_area = 100)  # Non-georeferenced image result <- sam_image("photo.jpg", text = "dog") dogs <- sam_as_sf(result)  # coordinates in pixels } # }

title: Batch Process Multiple Areas — sam_batch
text: Runs SAM3 detection multiple areas (polygons) returns combined results.

title: Batch Process Multiple Areas — sam_batch
code: sam_batch(   areas,   text,   source = "mapbox",   zoom = 17,   threshold = 0.5,   min_area = NULL,   max_area = NULL,   .progress = TRUE )

title: Batch Process Multiple Areas — sam_batch
text: areas sf object polygon geometries defining areas process. text Text prompt detection. source Imagery source: "mapbox", "esri", "google". zoom Tile zoom level imagery download. threshold Detection confidence threshold. min_area Minimum object area square meters. max_area Maximum object area square meters. .progress Logical. TRUE, shows progress bar.

title: Batch Process Multiple Areas — sam_batch
text: sf data frame detection results. Includes area_id column linking detections input areas.

title: Batch Process Multiple Areas — sam_batch
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(tigris)  # Process multiple counties counties <- counties("TX") |>   filter(NAME %in% c("Midland", "Ector"))  pads <- sam_batch(   areas = counties,   text = "swimming pool",   min_area = 500 ) } # }

code: sam_bbox(x)

text: x geosam object sam_detect() sam_explore().

text: sf bbox object, NULL detections.

title: Get Bounding Box of Detections — sam_bbox
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "building") bbox <- sam_bbox(result) } # }

title: Get Number of Detections — sam_count
text: Returns number detected objects.

title: Get Number of Detections — sam_count
code: sam_count(x)

text: x geosam geosam_image object.

text: Integer count detections.

what: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
title: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
text: Main function object detection using Meta's SAM3 model. Supports text prompts, point prompts, box prompts, exemplar-based detection.

title: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
code: sam_detect(   image = NULL,   bbox = NULL,   text = NULL,   boxes = NULL,   points = NULL,   labels = NULL,   exemplar = NULL,   source = "mapbox",   zoom = 17,   threshold = 0.5,   chunked = "auto" )

title: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
text: image Path GeoTIFF image, NULL download imagery bbox. bbox Bounding box area interest. Can numeric vector c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) WGS84, sf/sfc object. text Text prompt describing objects detect (e.g., "swimming pool", "swimming pool", "solar panel"). Uses SAM3's open-vocabulary detection. boxes sf object polygons/boxes use box prompts. points sf object points use point prompts. labels Integer vector labels point prompts (1 = foreground, 0 = background). NULL, points treated foreground. exemplar sf polygon representing example object. SAM3 find similar objects image. source Imagery source downloading: "mapbox", "esri", "google". zoom Tile zoom level imagery download (17-19 recommended). threshold Detection confidence threshold (0-1). Lower values return detections. chunked Control automatic chunking large areas. One : "auto" (default): Automatically chunk bbox large TRUE: Force chunked detection FALSE: Disable chunking (may reduce accuracy large areas)

title: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
text: geosam object containing detection masks metadata. Use sam_as_sf() extract polygons, sam_filter() filter area/score. Returns NULL objects detected.

title: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
text: large areas, detection automatically chunked maintain accuracy. means can pass large bounding box (e.g., census tract) get detection quality manually checked viewport.

title: Detect Objects in Geospatial Imagery Using SAM3 — sam_detect
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Text-based detection result <- sam_detect(   bbox = c(-102.5, 31.8, -102.4, 31.9),   text = "swimming pool" ) pads <- result |> sam_filter(min_area = 500) |> sam_as_sf()  # Large area - automatically chunked result <- sam_detect(   bbox = c(-118.45, 34.08, -118.40, 34.12),  # ~5km area   text = "swimming pool",   zoom = 18 )  # Point prompts on existing image result <- sam_detect(   image = "satellite.tif",   points = my_points_sf )  # Box prompts result <- sam_detect(   image = "satellite.tif",   boxes = my_boxes_sf )  # Exemplar-based detection result <- sam_detect(   image = "satellite.tif",   exemplar = my_example_polygon ) } # }

title: Interactive Discovery and Detection — sam_explore
text: Opens interactive map explore satellite imagery, draw prompts, run SAM detection.

title: Interactive Discovery and Detection — sam_explore
code: sam_explore(   source = c("mapbox", "esri", "maptiler"),   center = NULL,   bbox = NULL,   zoom = 15 )

title: Interactive Discovery and Detection — sam_explore
text: source Imagery source: "mapbox", "esri", "maptiler". "mapbox": Requires MAPBOX_PUBLIC_TOKEN environment variable "esri": Free Esri World Imagery (API key required) "maptiler": Requires MAPTILER_API_KEY environment variable center Initial map center c(lng, lat). NULL, defaults US center. bbox Initial bounding box c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) sf object. provided, map zoom extent. zoom Initial zoom level (default 15).

title: Interactive Discovery and Detection — sam_explore
text: geosam object user clicks "Done", NULL cancelled.

title: Interactive Discovery and Detection — sam_explore
text: explorer provides complete workflow: Navigate map find area interest Select prompt type (text, box, points, exemplar) Enter text draw prompts map Click "Detect" run SAM current viewport View results optionally refine +/- points Click "Done" return geosam object

title: Interactive Discovery and Detection — sam_explore
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Start exploring with Mapbox satellite result <- sam_explore(source = "mapbox", center = c(-102.5, 31.8), zoom = 15)  # Extract results if (!is.null(result)) {   polygons <- sam_as_sf(result) } } # }

what: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
title: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
text: Opens interactive viewer explore image run SAM detection using text prompts, point clicks, drawn boxes.

title: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
code: sam_explore_image(image)

title: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
text: image Path image file (PNG, JPG, etc.). Required.

title: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
text: geosam_image object user clicks "Done", NULL cancelled.

title: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
text: explorer provides complete workflow: View pan/zoom image Select prompt type (text, box, points) Enter text draw/click prompts image Click "Detect" run SAM View results Click "Done" return geosam_image object viewer uses MapLibre blank background image displayed raster layer, enabling standard map interactions.

title: Interactive Image Exploration and Detection — sam_explore_image
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Explore a photo result <- sam_explore_image("photo.jpg")  # Extract detected regions if (!is.null(result)) {   polygons <- sam_as_sf(result) } } # }

what: Filter Detections by Area or Score — sam_filter
title: Filter Detections by Area or Score — sam_filter
text: Filters detections geosam object based area /confidence score.

title: Filter Detections by Area or Score — sam_filter
code: sam_filter(x, min_area = NULL, max_area = NULL, min_score = NULL)

title: Filter Detections by Area or Score — sam_filter
text: x geosam object. min_area Minimum area square meters. max_area Maximum area square meters. min_score Minimum confidence score (0-1).

title: Filter Detections by Area or Score — sam_filter
text: new geosam object filtered detections.

title: Filter Detections by Area or Score — sam_filter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "building") filtered <- result |> sam_filter(min_area = 100, min_score = 0.7) } # }

what: Find Similar Objects Using Selected Detection as Exemplar — sam_find_similar
title: Find Similar Objects Using Selected Detection as Exemplar — sam_find_similar
text: Uses single selected detection exemplar find similar objects image.

title: Find Similar Objects Using Selected Detection as Exemplar — sam_find_similar
code: sam_find_similar(x)

title: Find Similar Objects Using Selected Detection as Exemplar — sam_find_similar
text: x geosam object exactly one detection (use sam_select() first).

title: Find Similar Objects Using Selected Detection as Exemplar — sam_find_similar
text: new geosam object detected similar objects.

title: Find Similar Objects Using Selected Detection as Exemplar — sam_find_similar
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "swimming pool") # View results, pick the best one, find all similar similar <- result |>   sam_select(3) |>   sam_find_similar() } # }

what: Detect Objects in a Local Image — sam_image
title: Detect Objects in a Local Image — sam_image
text: Run SAM3 object detection non-georeferenced image (PNG, JPG, etc.). georeferenced satellite imagery, use sam_detect() instead.

title: Detect Objects in a Local Image — sam_image
code: sam_image(   image,   text = NULL,   points = NULL,   labels = NULL,   boxes = NULL,   exemplar = NULL,   threshold = 0.5 )

title: Detect Objects in a Local Image — sam_image
text: image Path image file (PNG, JPG, TIFF, etc.). text Text prompt describing objects detect (e.g., "car", "person"). points Matrix data.frame point coordinates pixels (x, y). Column 1 x (horizontal), column 2 y (vertical, top). labels Integer vector labels point prompts (1 = foreground, 0 = background). NULL, points treated foreground. boxes Matrix data.frame box coordinates pixels. row: (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax). exemplar Vector box coordinates exemplar (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax). threshold Detection confidence threshold (0-1).

title: Detect Objects in a Local Image — sam_image
text: geosam_image object containing detection masks metadata. Use sam_as_sf() extract polygons (pixel coordinates). Returns NULL objects detected.

title: Detect Objects in a Local Image — sam_image
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Text-based detection on a photo result <- sam_image("photo.jpg", text = "dog")  # Point prompts (click locations in pixels) result <- sam_image("photo.jpg", points = matrix(c(100, 200, 150, 250), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))  # Extract polygons polys <- sam_as_sf(result) } # }

what: Check if Model is Loaded — sam_is_loaded
title: Check if Model is Loaded — sam_is_loaded
text: Checks whether SAM3 model currently loaded memory.

title: Check if Model is Loaded — sam_is_loaded
code: sam_is_loaded()

title: Check if Model is Loaded — sam_is_loaded
text: Logical indicating whether model loaded.

title: Load SAM3 Model — sam_load
text: Loads SAM3 model memory. Useful interactive use Shiny apps want keep model warm calls.

title: Load SAM3 Model — sam_load
code: sam_load(device = "auto")

title: Load SAM3 Model — sam_load
text: device Device load model : "auto", "mps", "cuda", "cpu".

title: Load SAM3 Model — sam_load
text: Invisibly returns TRUE success.

title: Load SAM3 Model — sam_load
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load model before making multiple detections sam_load()  # Now detections are faster result1 <- sam_detect(image = "img1.tif", text = "building") result2 <- sam_detect(image = "img2.tif", text = "building")  # Unload when done sam_unload() } # }

what: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
title: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
text: detecting objects large areas, geosam uses tiled processing can split objects span tile boundaries multiple polygons. function merges polygons close together, healing splits.

title: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
code: sam_merge_edges(x, buffer = 2, by_prompt = TRUE)

title: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
text: x geosam object sf object detection results. buffer Distance meters buffer polygons checking overlap. Larger values merge polygons apart. Default 2. by_prompt TRUE prompt column exists, merge polygons prompt value. Default TRUE.

title: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
text: sf object merged polygons. Scores aggregated taking maximum score merged polygons.

title: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
text: function useful notice objects split regular intervals (tile boundaries). default buffer 2 meters catches boundary splits without merging truly separate objects. aggressive merging nearby objects (just boundary splits), use larger buffer value, aware may merge objects remain separate.

title: Merge Polygons Split at Tile Boundaries — sam_merge_edges
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Detect buildings over a large area (uses tiling internally) buildings <- sam_detect(   bbox = c(-118.5, 34.0, -118.4, 34.1),   text = "building",   zoom = 18 )  # Merge any buildings split at tile boundaries merged <- sam_merge_edges(buildings)  # More aggressive merging (5m buffer) merged <- sam_merge_edges(buildings, buffer = 5) } # }

title: Get Detection Scores — sam_scores
text: Returns confidence scores detections.

title: Get Detection Scores — sam_scores
code: sam_scores(x)

title: Get Detection Scores — sam_scores
text: x geosam geosam_image object.

title: Get Detection Scores — sam_scores

what: Select Specific Detections by Index — sam_select
title: Select Specific Detections by Index — sam_select
text: Subsets geosam object include specific detections.

title: Select Specific Detections by Index — sam_select
code: sam_select(x, index)

title: Select Specific Detections by Index — sam_select
text: x geosam object. index Integer vector indices keep.

title: Select Specific Detections by Index — sam_select
text: new geosam object selected detections.

title: Select Specific Detections by Index — sam_select
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "building") # Keep only the top 3 scoring detections top3 <- sam_select(result, order(sam_scores(result), decreasing = TRUE)[1:3]) } # }

what: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
title: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
text: Opens interactive map viewer view SAM detections.

title: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
code: sam_view(   x,   fill = "#FACC15",   border = "#EAB308",   fill_opacity = 0.5,   source = NULL )

title: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
text: x geosam object sam_detect(). fill Fill color detection polygons. Default "#FACC15" (yellow). border Border/outline color polygons. Default "#EAB308". fill_opacity Fill opacity detection polygons (0-1). Default 0.5. source Imagery source basemap: "mapbox", "esri", "maptiler". NULL (default), uses source geosam object available, otherwise falls back "mapbox" "esri" API key set.

title: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
text: geosam object user clicks "Done".

title: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
text: viewer shows satellite imagery current detections overlaid. Note: Point-based refinement yet fully implemented. current version view-.

title: Interactive Viewer for SAM Detections — sam_view
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- sam_detect(image = "satellite.tif", text = "building") refined <- sam_view(result)  # Custom colors sam_view(result, fill = "#3B82F6", border = "#1D4ED8") } # }
